alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sumner County through 600 AM CDT... At 512 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Haven, or 7 miles east of Caldwell, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Caldwell, South Haven, Geuda Springs, Hunnewell and Perth. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
